channel.title: Client.jar Error (Still Not Resolved)
channel.description:
Okay, so I want to Jar and Sign my server's client to make a webclient, but when I try to run my client.jar (I actually named the file Webclient.jar) nothing happens. I had my Jar Maker generate a .bat file of my client so that I could see what the error is. This is what came up when I tried to run the client.bat (Webclient.bat).
[IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/2j2hr9f.jpg[/img]
Does anyone know how to fix this? Could it be because my .class and .java files aren't in their own folders? When I put them in their own folders, my client is unable to open. Any help would be much appreciated. Thanks.
P.S. I used the Jar Maker from http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/. Also I have jkd 7.1.0_04 if that helps at all.

item.title: Client.jar Error (Still Not Resolved)
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

LOWERCASE! > client Change the main fest to that.

Read full topic

not ur bat file… if ur shure the main is Client.class
then search ur source for it and right click and go to containing folder and check if its in ur folder or is it sub foldered cuz if its subfoldered then ur input files has to be the sub folder when the main is i think… im also kinds new to java and rspes …

item.title: Client.jar Error (Still Not Resolved)
item.dc:creator: @silicoofficial silicoofficial
item.description:
@silicoofficial wrote:

[quote=“tomato721, post:3, topic:444965”]remember if ur main class is RunClient then put runclient or if itslike 317 its Client

Another importanp point!
REMEMBER TO USE CAPS AS JAVA IS A CASE SENSITIVE LANGUAGE
so put Client and not client[/quote]Okay, I set the file name to be “client.jar” and the Main-Class: “Client”. This is the error I get now.

Is it supposed to be the same name as the .bat file I normally use to open my client? Here is a picture of my client folder.

2z9cqk3.jpg627×593

So like would I have to name my Main-Class: “1Play Here”?

Read full topic

Okay, so I want to Jar and Sign my server’s client to make a webclient, but when I try to run my client.jar (I actually named the file Webclient.jar) nothing happens.
